questions.prompt: The legendary Cypriot king who carved a statue of a woman so beautiful that he fell in love with it (and eventually married her, after Aphrodite turned it into an actual woman) gives his name to what 1913 play?

What was the title of author Vikram Seth's 1986 novel, written entirely in metered, rhyming 14-line stanzas, about the popular culture and activities of a group of "Yuppies" in San Francisco (hence the name)?
What is the common name (in English) for the head of government of a Canadian province that is roughly equivalent to a US state's "governor"?
The word for the part of a pistil in a flower that receives pollen grains during pollination can also be defined as a mark of shame or disgrace. What is that word?
Detroit-born brothers Brian and Eddie Holland played a sizeable role in defining the Motown sound in popular music, most famously in close collaboration with what third songwriter and producer?
What Chevrolet model, named after a bovid and first introduced in 1958 (and re-introduced in 1994 and re-re-introduced in 2000), was the best-selling automobile in the United States during the 1960s?
